headline: Nice environment to work
pros: Good opportunities to learn new stuff. Friendly environment to work. Reasonably salary. Depending on the team you work at, interesting challenges. Flexible shifts.
cons: No career plan (usually you only get promoted when you get another job, i.e., when it is too late). Not an innovative company, but rather a follower one. No space to change company's culture, which is imposed top-down.

headline: Working at UOL
pros: One of the main Brazilian online companies, Brazilian greatest news portal with products ranging from advertising to online payments, also including many other such as hosting and e-mail.
cons: Small teams are responsible for very large projects, not enough resources. Many development teams are already trying to adapt to an agile software development culture, however, other areas are not following this mandatory evolution. Company managed by journalists without realizing it has become a technology company. Strong hierarchy and lots of bureaucracy.

headline: Very good place to work

Managers making choices based on personal impressions about people (but not on their professional history) seems to be just above the acceptable.

headline: Working at Universo Online
pros: It's good because you have opportunities to grow in your team, develop for a company that is leader in it's market and the biggest portal in portuguese idiom, so you'll gain a lot of relevant experience. You'll always have a plan of what you need to do during a sprint, so it's hard to lose control of your daily tasks.
cons: Despite the fact that you'll know what you have to do, it's not so good when you need colaboration of other teams, because it's almost certain that they'll difficult the things a bit. The information it's not well shared between teams, so sometimes you can fell a little lost when you need to do something that depends of things maintained by other teams.
